text: The Righteous Will Live by Faith
I will stand at my post,
and station myself on \add the\add* rampart.
And I will keep watch to see what he will say to me,
and what he will answer concerning my complaint.
Then Yahweh answered me and said,
“Write \add the\add* vision and make \add it\add* plain on the tablet
so that ⸤it might be read quickly⸥.\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Literally “it might run reading upon it” \f*
For \add there is\add* yet a vision for the appointed time;
it will give witness to the end, and it will not lie.
If it tarries, wait for it,
for it will surely come and not delay.
Look! His spirit within him is puffed up;
it is not upright.
But the righteous shall live by his faithfulness.
⸤How much less⸥\f + \fr 2:5 \ft Literally “And moreover because” \f* the defiant;\f + \fr 2:5 \ft “Defiant” follows the Dead Sea Scrolls (1QpHab) \f*
\add the\add* arrogant, treacherous man?
He who broadens his throat like Sheol,
and who, like death, is not satisfied,
and who gathers to himself all the nations,
and harvested for himself all the peoples,
will not succeed.
Shall not all of these take up a taunt against him,
with ridicule and riddles against him, saying,
‘Woe to him who heaps up what is not his’?
\add For\add* how long?
And, ‘\add Woe to him\add* who makes himself heavy with pledges’?
Will not your creditors suddenly rise up
and awaken those who make you tremble?
Then you shall be as plunder for them.
Because you plundered many nations,
all the remaining nations will plunder you
on account of the blood of humanity
and violence \add against the\add* land,
\add and against\add* cities and all who live in them.
Woe to \add him who\add* obtains profit \add from\add* evil gain for his house,
to set his nest on high,
to be saved from the hand of misfortune!
You have plotted shame for your house,
cutting off many peoples
and sinning against your life.
For the stone will cry out from the wall,
and \add the\add* plaster from \add the\add* wood will answer it.
Woe to \add him who\add* builds a city by bloodguilt,
and \add who\add* founds a city by wickedness!
Look! \add Is it\add* not from Yahweh of hosts
that people labor for mere fire,
and nations exhaust themselves for mere vanity?
For the earth will be filled
with the knowledge of the glory of Yahweh,
like the waters covering the sea.
Woe to \add him who\add* gives a drink to his neighbors,
pouring out your wrath and also making \add them\add* drunk
in order to see their nakedness!
You will be sated with shame rather than glory.
Drink also yourself, and expose yourself!
The cup of the right hand of Yahweh
will come around upon you
and disgrace upon your glory.
For \add the\add* violence of Lebanon will cover you,
and \add the\add* destruction of wild animals will shatter them
on account of the blood of humanity,
and \add the\add* violence \add against the\add* land,
\add against\add* a city and all the inhabitants in it.
What value \add is\add* an idol
when its carver has fashioned it,
a molten idol, a teacher of lies?
For \add he who\add* fashioned his creation trusts in it,
\add though\add* making mute idols!
Woe to \add him who\add* says to the wood, ‘Wake up!’
\add And\add* to a lifeless stone, ‘Arise!’
Can he teach?
Look, it is covered \add with\add* gold and silver,
and there is no breath within it.
But Yahweh \add is\add* in his holy temple.
Let all the earth be silent before him.”
